doc.title: blast

description.text: The Basic Local Alignment Search Tool (BLAST) finds regions of local similarity between sequences.

doc.authors: Altschul, Madden, Schaeffer, Zhang, Miller, Lipman

doc.title: BLAST2
doc.reference: Altschul, Stephen F., Thomas L. Madden, Alejandro A. Schaeffer, Jinghui Zhang, Zheng Zhang, Webb Miller, and David J. Lipman (1997), Gapped BLAST and PSI-BLAST: a new generation of protein database search programs, Nucleic Acids Res. 25:3389-3402.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Read (first, query) sequence or set from file

xhtml:div.label:
Start of required region in query sequence (-L)?
Location on query sequence

End of required region in query sequence (-L)?
Location on query sequence
Number of concatenated queries (blastn or tblastn) (-B)

Cost to open a gap (-G)?
-1 invokes default behavior: non-affine if greedy, 5 if using dynamic programming

Cost to extend a gap (-E)?
Default: 2 for blastn; 1 for blastp, blastx and tblastn
Limited values for gap existence and extension are supported for these programs. Some supported and suggested values are:
Existence Extension
10 -- 1
10 -- 2
11 -- 1
8 -- 2
9 -- 2
Similarity matrix (-M) BLOSUM62 BLOSUM45 BLOSUM80 PAM30 PAM70
Penalty for a nucleotide mismatch (-q)
Reward for a nucleotide match (-r)
Frame shift penalty (-w)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: BLAST 2.0 uses the dust low-complexity filter for blastn and seg for the other programs.
If one uses '-F T' then normal filtering by seg or dust (for blastn) occurs (likewise '-F F' means no filtering whatsoever).

xhtml:div.label: Filter or Masking query sequence (DUST with blastn, SEG with others) (-F) Yes No

Filtering options (Filter must be true)?
Default Coiled-coiled filter (C) Both SEG and coiled-coiled filters ("C;S") DUST filter for DNA (D)
A coiled-coiled filter, based on the work of Lupas et al. (Science, vol 252, pp. 1162-4 (1991)) written by John Kuzio (Wilson et al., J Gen Virol, vol. 76, pp. 2923-32 (1995))

Masking options (Filter must be true)?
Masking with SEG should only be done during the building of initial words ("m S") Masking with coiled-coil should only be done during the building of initial words ("m D") Masking with DUST should only be done during the building of initial words ("m C") Lower-case masking (-U must be true) ( -F m")
A coiled-coiled filter, based on the work of Lupas et al. (Science, vol 252, pp. 1162-4 (1991)) written by John Kuzio (Wilson et al., J Gen Virol, vol. 76, pp. 2923-32 (1995)).
It is possible to specify that the masking should only be done during the process of building the initial words .
If the -U option (to mask any lower-case sequence in the input FASTA file) is used and one does not wish any other filtering, but does wish to mask when building the lookup tables then one should specify: -F 'm'

Use lower case filtering (-U)?
Yes No
This option specifies that any lower-case letters in the input FASTA file should be masked.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The programs blastn and blastp offer fully gapped alignments. blastx and tblastn have 'in-frame' gapped alignments and use sum statistics to link alignments from different frames. tblastx provides only ungapped alignments.

xhtml:div.label:
Expected value (-e)?
The statistical significance threshold for reporting matches against database sequences; the default value is 10, such that 10 matches are expected to be found merely by chance, according to the stochastic model of Karlin and Altschul (1990). If the statistical significance ascribed to a match is greater than the EXPECT threshold, the match will not be reported. Lower EXPECT thresholds are more stringent, leading to fewer chance matches being reported. Fractional values are acceptable.

Word Size (-W)?
Use words of size N.
Zero invokes default behavior
Default values:
- 11 for blastn
- 3 for others

Multiple Hits window size (-A)?
Generally defaults to 0 (for single-hit extensions), but defaults to 40 when using discontiguous templates.

Threshold for extending hits (-f)?
Blast seeks first short word pairs whose aligned score reaches at least this value.
Default values:
- 0 for blastn
- 11 for blastp
- 12 for blastx
- 13 for tblastn and tblastx

X dropoff value for gapped alignment (-X)?
This is the value that control the path graph region explored by Blast during a gapped extension (Xg in the NAR paper) (default for blastp is 15).
Default values:
- 30 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 15 for others

X dropoff value for ungapped extention (-y)?
- 0.0: default behavior:
- 20 for blastn
- 7 for others

X dropoff value for final gapped alignment (-Z)?
Default values:
- 100 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 25 for others

Effective length of the search space (-Y)?
Use zero for the real size

Number of best hits from a region to keep (-K)?
If this option is used, a value of 100 is recommended.
Perform or not gapped alignment (not available with tblastx) (-g) Yes No
Single-hit or multiple-hit mode (-P) Multiple-hit (0) Single-hit (1)

Genetic code used for query translation (-Q) Standard (1) Vertebrate Mitochondrial (2) Yeast Mitochondrial (3) Mold, Protozoan, Coelenterate Mitochondrial and Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma (4) Invertebrate Mitochondrial (5) Ciliate Macronuclear and Dasycladacean (6) Echinoderm Mitochondrial (9) Euplotid Nuclear (10) Bacterial (11) Alternative Yeast Nuclear (12) Ascidian Mitochondrial (13) Flatworm Mitochondrial (14) Blepharisma Macronuclear (15)

Genetic code used for database translation (-D) Standard (1) Vertebrate Mitochondrial (2) Yeast Mitochondrial (3) Mold, Protozoan, Coelenterate Mitochondrial and Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma (4) Invertebrate Mitochondrial (5) Ciliate Macronuclear and Dasycladacean (6) Echinoderm Mitochondrial (9) Euplotid Nuclear (10) Bacterial (11) Alternative Yeast Nuclear (12) Ascidian Mitochondrial (13) Flatworm Mitochondrial (14) Blepharisma Macronuclear (15)
Query strands to search against database (-S) Top (1) Bottom (2) Both (3)

Number of one-line descriptions to show (-v)?
Maximum number of database sequences for which one-line descriptions will be reported.

Number of database sequences to show alignments (-b)?
Maximum number of database sequences for which high-scoring segment pairs will be reported (-b).

Alignment view options (-m) Pairwise (0) Query-anchored showing identities (1) Query-anchored no identities (2) Flat query-anchored, show identities (3) Flat query-anchored, no identities (5) Query-anchored no identities and blunt ends (5) Flat query-anchored, no identities and blunt ends (6) XML Blast output (7) Tabular output (8)
Html output Yes No

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: - Blastp compares an amino acid query sequence against a protein sequence database;
- Blastn compares a nucleotide query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database;
- Blastx compares the six-frame conceptual translation products of a nucleotide query sequence (both strands) against a protein sequence database;
- tBlastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands).
- tBlastx compares the six-frame translations of a nucleotide query sequence against the six-frame translations of a nucleotide sequence database.

- psitBlastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands) using a position specific matrix created by PSI-BLAST.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

Please note that Swissprot usage by and for commercial entities requires a license agreement.

Existence Extension
A coiled-coiled filter, based on the work of Lupas et al. (Science, vol 252, pp. 1162-4 (1991)) written by John Kuzio (Wilson et al., J Gen Virol, vol. 76, pp. 2923-32 (1995))
A coiled-coiled filter, based on the work of Lupas et al. (Science, vol 252, pp. 1162-4 (1991)) written by John Kuzio (Wilson et al., J Gen Virol, vol. 76, pp. 2923-32 (1995)).
It is possible to specify that the masking should only be done during the process of building the initial words .

If the -U option (to mask any lower-case sequence in the input FASTA file) is used and one does not wish any other filtering, but does wish to mask when building the lookup tables then one should specify: -F 'm'
This option specifies that any lower-case letters in the input FASTA file should be masked.

The statistical significance threshold for reporting matches against database sequences; the default value is 10, such that 10 matches are expected to be found merely by chance, according to the stochastic model of Karlin and Altschul (1990). If the statistical significance ascribed to a match is greater than the EXPECT threshold, the match will not be reported. Lower EXPECT thresholds are more stringent, leading to fewer chance matches being reported. Fractional values are acceptable.
Use words of size N.
Zero invokes default behavior
Default values:
- 11 for blastn
- 3 for others
Generally defaults to 0 (for single-hit extensions), but defaults to 40 when using discontiguous templates.
Blast seeks first short word pairs whose aligned score reaches at least this value.
Default values:
- 0 for blastn
- 11 for blastp
- 12 for blastx
- 13 for tblastn and tblastx
This is the value that control the path graph region explored by Blast during a gapped extension (Xg in the NAR paper) (default for blastp is 15).
Default values:

- 0 for tblastx
- 15 for others
- 0.0: default behavior:
- 20 for blastn

Default values:

- 25 for others
Use zero for the real size
If this option is used, a value of 100 is recommended.
Maximum number of database sequences for which one-line descriptions will be reported.
Maximum number of database sequences for which high-scoring segment pairs will be reported (-b).

velem.label: tBlastx (translated nucleotide query / translated nucleotide db)

comment.text: - Blastp compares an amino acid query sequence against a protein sequence database;
- Blastn compares a nucleotide query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database;
- Blastx compares the six-frame conceptual translation products of a nucleotide query sequence (both strands) against a protein sequence database;
- tBlastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands).
- tBlastx compares the six-frame translations of a nucleotide query sequence against the six-frame translations of a nucleotide sequence database.

- psitBlastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands) using a position specific matrix created by PSI-BLAST.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: - Blastp compares an amino acid query sequence against a protein sequence database;
- Blastn compares a nucleotide query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database;
- Blastx compares the six-frame conceptual translation products of a nucleotide query sequence (both strands) against a protein sequence database;
- tBlastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands).
- tBlastx compares the six-frame translations of a nucleotide query sequence against the six-frame translations of a nucleotide sequence database.

- psitBlastn compares a protein query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database dynamically translated in all six reading frames (both strands) using a position specific matrix created by PSI-BLAST.

- 12 for blastx
- 13 for tblastn and tblastx

parameter.name: dropoff_extent
parameter.prompt: X dropoff value for gapped alignment (-X)

comment.text: This is the value that control the path graph region explored by Blast during a gapped extension (Xg in the NAR paper) (default for blastp is 15).
Default values:
- 30 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 15 for others

interface.label:
X dropoff value for gapped alignment (-X)?
This is the value that control the path graph region explored by Blast during a gapped extension (Xg in the NAR paper) (default for blastp is 15).
Default values:
- 30 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 15 for others

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This is the value that control the path graph region explored by Blast during a gapped extension (Xg in the NAR paper) (default for blastp is 15).
Default values:
- 30 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 15 for others

parameter.name: dropoff_extent_ungapped
parameter.prompt: X dropoff value for ungapped extention (-y)

format.code: ("" , " -y "+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]

comment.text: - 0.0: default behavior:
- 20 for blastn
- 7 for others

interface.label:
X dropoff value for ungapped extention (-y)?
- 0.0: default behavior:
- 20 for blastn
- 7 for others

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: - 0.0: default behavior:
- 20 for blastn
- 7 for others

parameter.name: dropoff_final
parameter.prompt: X dropoff value for final gapped alignment (-Z)

comment.text: Default values:
- 100 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 25 for others

interface.label:
X dropoff value for final gapped alignment (-Z)?
Default values:
- 100 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 25 for others

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Default values:
- 100 for blastn
- 0 for tblastx
- 25 for others

parameter.name: eff_len
parameter.prompt: Effective length of the search space (-Y)

comment.text: Use zero for the real size

interface.label:
Effective length of the search space (-Y)?
Use zero for the real size

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Use zero for the real size

parameter.name: keep_hits
parameter.prompt: Number of best hits from a region to keep (-K)

comment.text: If this option is used, a value of 100 is recommended.

interface.label:
Number of best hits from a region to keep (-K)?
If this option is used, a value of 100 is recommended.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: If this option is used, a value of 100 is recommended.

parameter.name: gapped_alig
parameter.prompt: Perform or not gapped alignment (not available with tblastx) (-g)

interface.label: Perform or not gapped alignment (not available with tblastx) (-g) Yes No
Single-hit or multiple-hit mode (-P) Multiple-hit (0) Single-hit (1)

parameter.name: gc_query
parameter.prompt: Genetic code used for query translation (-Q)

velem.label: Mold, Protozoan, Coelenterate Mitochondrial and Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma (4)

format.code: ("" , " -Q "+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label: Genetic code used for query translation (-Q) Standard (1) Vertebrate Mitochondrial (2) Yeast Mitochondrial (3) Mold, Protozoan, Coelenterate Mitochondrial and Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma (4) Invertebrate Mitochondrial (5) Ciliate Macronuclear and Dasycladacean (6) Echinoderm Mitochondrial (9) Euplotid Nuclear (10) Bacterial (11) Alternative Yeast Nuclear (12) Ascidian Mitochondrial (13) Flatworm Mitochondrial (14) Blepharisma Macronuclear (15)

parameter.name: gc_db
parameter.prompt: Genetic code used for database translation (-D)

velem.label: Mold, Protozoan, Coelenterate Mitochondrial and Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma (4)

interface.label: Genetic code used for database translation (-D) Standard (1) Vertebrate Mitochondrial (2) Yeast Mitochondrial (3) Mold, Protozoan, Coelenterate Mitochondrial and Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma (4) Invertebrate Mitochondrial (5) Ciliate Macronuclear and Dasycladacean (6) Echinoderm Mitochondrial (9) Euplotid Nuclear (10) Bacterial (11) Alternative Yeast Nuclear (12) Ascidian Mitochondrial (13) Flatworm Mitochondrial (14) Blepharisma Macronuclear (15)

parameter.name: strand
parameter.prompt: Query strands to search against database (-S)

format.code: ("" , " -S "+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label: Query strands to search against database (-S) Top (1) Bottom (2) Both (3)

parameter.name: Descriptions
parameter.prompt: Number of one-line descriptions to show (-v)

format.code: ("" , " -v "+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]

comment.text: Maximum number of database sequences for which one-line descriptions will be reported.

interface.label:
Number of one-line descriptions to show (-v)?
Maximum number of database sequences for which one-line descriptions will be reported.

Flat query-anchored, no identities and blunt ends (6)

format.code: ("" , " -m "+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]
